verses.verse: Better<WH2896> is the poor<WH7326> who walks<WH1980> in his integrity<WH8537> than he who is perverse<WH6141> in his lips<WH8193> and is a fool.<WH3684>
It isn't<WH2896> good to have zeal<WH5315> without knowledge;<WH1847> nor being hasty<WH213> with one<WH7272>'s feet and missing the way.<WH2398>
The foolishness<WH200> of man<WH120> subverts<WH5557> his way;<WH1870> his heart<WH3820> rages<WH2196> against Yahweh.<WH3068>
Wealth<WH1952> adds<WH3254> many<WH7227> friends,<WH7453> but the poor<WH1800> is separated<WH6504> from his friend.<WH7453>
A false<WH8267> witness<WH5707> shall not be unpunished.<WH5352> He who pours<WH6315> out lies<WH3577> shall not go free.<WH4422>
Many<WH7227> will entreat<WH2470> the favor<WH6440> of a ruler,<WH5081> and everyone is a friend<WH7453> to a man<WH376> who gives gifts.<WH4976>
All the relatives<WH251> of the poor<WH7326> shun<WH8130> him:<WH4828> how much more do his friends avoid<WH7368> him!<WH7291> He pursues them with pleas,<WH561> but they are gone.
He who gets<WH7069> wisdom<WH3820> loves<WH157> his own soul.<WH5315> He who keeps<WH8104> understanding<WH8394> shall find<WH4672> good.<WH2896>
A false<WH8267> witness<WH5707> shall not be unpunished.<WH5352> He who utters<WH6315> lies<WH3577> shall perish.<WH6>
Delicate<WH8588> living is not appropriate<WH5000> for a fool,<WH3684> much less for a servant<WH5650> to have rule<WH4910> over princes.<WH8269>
The discretion<WH7922> of a man<WH120> makes him slow<WH748> to anger.<WH639> It is his glory<WH8597> to overlook<WH5674> an offense.<WH6588>
The king<WH4428>'s wrath<WH2197> is like the roaring<WH5099> of a lion,<WH3715> but his favor<WH7522> is like dew<WH2919> on the grass.<WH6212>
A foolish<WH3684> son<WH1121> is the calamity<WH1942> of his father.<WH1> A wife<WH802>'s quarrels<WH4079> are a continual<WH2956> dripping.<WH1812>
House<WH1004> and riches<WH1952> are an inheritance<WH5159> from fathers,<WH1> but a prudent<WH7919> wife<WH802> is from Yahweh.<WH3068>
Slothfulness<WH6103> casts<WH5307> into a deep sleep.<WH8639> The idle<WH7423> soul<WH5315> shall suffer hunger.<WH7456>
He who keeps<WH8104> the commandment<WH4687> keeps<WH8104> his soul,<WH5315> but he who is contemptuous<WH959> in his ways<WH1870> shall die.<WH4191>
He who has pity<WH2603> on the poor<WH1800> lends<WH3867> to Yahweh;<WH3068> he will<WH1576> reward him.<WH7999>
Discipline<WH3256> your son,<WH1121> for there is<WH3426> hope;<WH8615> don't<WH5315> be a willing party<WH5375> to his death.<WH4191>
A hot<WH1632> - tempered<WH2534> man<WH1419> must pay<WH5375> the penalty,<WH6066> for if you rescue<WH5337> him,<WH3254> you must do it again.
Listen<WH8085> to counsel<WH6098> and receive<WH6901> instruction,<WH4148> that you may be wise<WH2449> in your latter end.<WH319>
There are many<WH7227> plans<WH4284> in a man<WH376>'s heart,<WH3820> but Yahweh<WH3068>'s counsel<WH6098> will prevail.<WH6965>
That which makes a man<WH120> to be desired<WH8378> is his kindness.<WH2617> A poor man<WH7326> is better<WH2896> than<WH376> a liar.<WH3577>
The fear<WH3374> of Yahweh<WH3068> leads to life,<WH2416> then contentment;<WH7649> he rests<WH3885> and will not be touched<WH6485> by trouble.<WH7451>
The sluggard<WH6102> buries<WH2934> his hand<WH3027> in the dish;<WH6747> he will not so much as bring<WH7725> it to his mouth<WH6310> again.<WH7725>
Flog<WH5221> a scoffer,<WH3887> and the simple<WH6612> will learn prudence;<WH6191> rebuke<WH3198> one who has understanding,<WH995> and he will gain<WH995> knowledge.<WH1847>
He who robs<WH7703> his father<WH1> and drives away<WH1272> his mother,<WH517> is a son<WH1121> who causes shame<WH954> and brings reproach.<WH2659>
If you stop<WH2308> listening<WH8085> to instruction,<WH4148> my son,<WH1121> you will stray<WH7686> from the words<WH561> of knowledge.<WH1847>
A corrupt<WH1100> witness<WH5707> mocks<WH3887> justice,<WH4941> and the mouth<WH6310> of the wicked<WH7563> gulps<WH1104> down iniquity.<WH7563>
Penalties<WH8201> are prepared<WH3559> for scoffers,<WH3887> and beatings<WH4112> for the backs<WH1460> of fools.<WH3684>
